Package pathfinder.textInterface

Enum Direction

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Direction>
pathfinder.textInterface.Direction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Direction>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum Direction
extends java.lang.Enum<Direction>
Represents one of the 4 major or 4 minor compass directions, as is capable of resolving the direction between two points or from the origin to a point.

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static Direction resolveDirection​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, CoordinateProperties coordType)
    Determines the direction represented by the ray cast from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) in a cartesian plane, after accounting for differing coordinate system basis directions using the options in CoordinateProperties.

    • resolveDirection

      public static Direction resolveDirection​(double x, double y, CoordinateProperties coordType)
      Determines the direction represented by the ray cast from (0, 0) to (x, y) in a cartesian plane, after accounting for differing coordinate system basis directions using the options in CoordinateProperties. In the case that a coordinate pair borders on the end between two directions, the more counter-clockwise of the two is returned.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the head of the ray being measured.
      y - The y-coordinate of the head of the ray being measured.
      coordType - The type of coordinate system that x and y exist in.
      Returns:
      The direction represented by the ray from the origin to (x, y).
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the calculation cannot be completed, such as if x or y are NaN.

    • resolveDirection

      public static Direction resolveDirection​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, CoordinateProperties coordType)
      Determines the direction represented by the ray cast from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) in a cartesian plane, after accounting for differing coordinate system basis directions using the options in CoordinateProperties. In the case that a coordinate pair borders on the end between two directions, the more counter-clockwise of the two is returned.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x-coordinate of the base of the ray being measured.
      y1 - The y-coordinate of the base of the ray being measured.
      x2 - The x-coordinate of the head of the ray being measured.
      y2 - The y-coordinate of the head of the ray being measured.
      coordType - The type of coordinate system that x1, x2, y1, y2 exist in.
      Returns:
      The direction represented by the ray from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2).
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the calculation cannot be completed, such as if x1, x2, y1, or y2 are NaN.
